attributes.action: abolish the ‘non-domicile’ status which HMRC uses to excuse high earners from paying their full share of income tax.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: ‘Non-domicile’ status is only available to super-rich residents who wish to avoid/evade paying their fair share of income tax. Some might argue that the country needs such people in our midst as they help create wealth for others. However, the only effect most of us have noticed is the inordinate height to which house prices have risen as a direct result of the super-rich invading the market. In London and the South-East, in particular, house prices have risen to the extent that young professionals such as teachers and university lecturers cannot afford to buy a house. If professional people cannot afford to buy houses, it’s no wonder that prison officers, fire-fighters, nurses and other key workers cannot afford to make ends meet and buy a house. It’s time this discrimination in favour of the rich, i.e. ‘non-domicile’ status, was abolished.
